conclusion: Determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second using the x/t-time graph.
The vertical axis represents position divided by time (x/t) in meters per second (m/s), and the horizontal axis represents time in seconds (s).
At t = 0, the value of x/t is 10 m/s, as marked by the red dot.
The graph is a straight line, indicating a constant velocity.
The general equation of a straight line is y = mx + c.
Identify y as x/t, x as t, m as the slope, and c as the y-intercept.
The line passes through the point (-2, 0) and (0, 10).
The line crosses the y-axis at 10 m/s.
Substitute t = 2 into the equation to find x/t = 20 m/s.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 20 m/s.
